IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: AN INDEPENDENT ELEMENTARY & MIDDLE SCHOOL FOR BOYS & GIRLS IN PRE-KINDERGARTEN THROUGH GRADE 8.
IRS990.MissionDesc: AN INDEPENDENT ELEMENTARY AND MIDDLE SCHOOL FOR BOYS AND GIRLS IN PRE-KINDERGARTEN THROUGH GRADE EIGHT.
IRS990.Desc: THE SCHOOL IS A PRIVATE CO-EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION SERVING PRIMARY, LOWER AND MIDDLE SCHOOL STUDENTS THROUGH GRADE EIGHT. THE STUDENT BODY IS APPROXIMATELY 250 STUDENTS. IT ALSO PROVIDES AN EIGHT WEEK SUMMER DAY CAMP.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: MISCELLANEOUS INCOME - 2015 AMOUNT: $ 24,169. 2016 AMOUNT: $ 16,479. 2017 AMOUNT: $ 20,560. FUNDRAISING NET - 2013 AMOUNT: $ 73,018. 2014 AMOUNT: $ 373,165. 2015 AMOUNT: $ 2,638. 2016 AMOUNT: $ 17,517.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED FOR FINANCIAL AID AND OTHER DONOR SPECIFIED EXPENDITURES.
LOSS ON WRITE-OFF OF PLEDGE RECEIVABLE -1,007,739.
DEDHAM COUNTRY DAY SCHOOL IS INCLUDED IN THE ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS IN NEW ENGLAND AND IS INCLUDED IN THEIR NOTICE OF NON-DISCRIMINATORY POLICY AS TO STUDENTS.

DEDHAM COUNTRY DAY SCHOOL USES SCHOOL AND STUDENT SERVICES BY THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS (SSS BY NAIS) AS A BENCHMARK. THE FAMILY FILLS OUT A PERSONAL FINANCIAL STATEMENT AND UPLOADS TAX INFORMATION WITH THEIR APPLICATION THROUGH SSS BY NAIS.
DEDHAM COUNTRY DAY SCHOOL REQUIRES THAT THE HEAD OF SCHOOL LIVE ON CAMPUS IN SCHOOL PROVIDED HOUSING. THE HOUSING IS NOT CONSIDERED A TAXABLE BENEFIT.

DEDHAM COUNTRY DAY SCHOOL HAS A 457(F) NON-QUALIFIED DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN FOR SELECT MEMBERS OF SENIOR MANAGEMENT. THE NON-QUALIFIED DEFERRED COMPENSATION IS SUBJECT TO A SUBSTANTIAL RISK OF FORFEITURE AND WILL BE PAID UPON VESTING. THE SCHOOL DID NOT ACCRUE OR PAY OUT ANY NON-QUALIFIED DEFERRED COMPENSATION AMOUNTS FOR THE YEARS ENDING JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: TO PAY OFF PRIOR BOND ISSUANCE AND CAMPUS EXPANSION PROJECT

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL IS IN THE PROCESS OF REVIEWING AND ADOPTING WRITTEN POST-ISSUANCE TAX-EXEMPT BOND COMPLIANCE PROCEDURES.
THE AMOUNT IN COLUMN B REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: JOHN CONNORS AND SUSANNE JOYCE ARE BROTHER AND SISTER AND ARE BOTH TRUSTEES AND CO-PRESIDENTS ON DEDHAM COUNTRY DAY'S BOARD. ERIN AND MARK EPKER ARE MARRIED AND ARE BOTH TRUSTEES; MARK IS ALSO TREASURER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S MEMBERS CONSIST OF EVERY PARENT OR LEGAL GUUARDIAN OF A CHILD ENROLLED AT DEDHAM COUNTRY DAY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MEMBERS ELECT THE GOVERNING BODY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FOLLOWING PREPARATION BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND THE TAX ADVISORS, THE FORM 990 IS SENT TO THE CHAIR OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE CHAIR REVIEWS THE FORM 990 AND PROVIDES A COPY TO ALL TRUSTEES FOR APPROXIMATELY ONE WEEK. IF THERE ARE NO QUESTIONS, THE CHAIR REQUESTS THAT THE PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM FILE IT WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TRUSTEES, OFFICERS, ADMINISTRATORS, COMMITTEE MEMBERS AND ADVISORS OF DEDHAM COUNTRY DAY SCHOOL ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ANNUALLY WITH THE HEAD OF SCHOOL WITHIN 30 DAYS OF THE ANNUAL MEETING. THE INDIVIDUAL WITH THE POTENTIAL CONFLICT IS ABLE TO STATE HIS OR HER POSITION IN THE MEETING AND ANSWER ANY QUESTIONS HOWEVER HE OR SHE CANNOT BE PRESENT WHEN THE CONFLICT IS DISCUSSED AND CANNOT VOTE ON THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED BY A COMMITTEE CONSISTING OF FIVE BOARD MEMBERS AND TWO FACULTY MEMBERS. AS PART OF THE SEARCH PROCESS, A COMPENSATION SUB-COMMITTEE WAS FORMED CONSISTING OF THE COMMITTEE CHAIR AND TWO OTHER BOARD MEMBERS WITH EMPLOYMENT AND FINANCIAL EXPERTISE. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE COLLECTED AND SUMMARIZED RELEVANT BENCHMARK DATA FROM THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF SCHOOLS AND OTHER SOURCES TO GAIN VISIBILITY INTO COMPENSATION RANGES FOR SIMILAR SCHOOLS: 1. SCHOOLS WITH OPERATING BUDGETS $6-12M RANGE; 2. NEW ENGLAND REGIONAL SCHOOLS; AND 3. THE NUMBER OF ACTIVE AND UPCOMING HEAD SEARCHES IN PEER SCHOOLS AND COMPENSATION PACKAGES CURRENTLY BEING OFFERED 4. THEY ALSO FACTORED INTO THE EQUATION THAT THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT IN THE TOP QUARTILE BUT MORE IN THE 70TH PERCENTILE RANGE. THESE AND OTHER FACTORS, WERE ALL TAKEN INTO CONSIDERATION. THEY THEN DELIBERATED AS A COMMITTEE AND BROUGH THEIR RECOMMENDATION TO THE BOARD. WHILE THERE ARE NO OFFICIAL COMMITTEE MEETING MINUTES, THE GROUP DID DOCUMENT THEIR DISCUSSIONS AND DELIBERATIONS WITH EMAILS THAT CIRCULATED WITHIN THE GROUP AS THE PROCESS WAS UNDERWAY AND BY RETAINING THE BENCHMARKING DATA. COMPENSATION FOR ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES IS DETERMINED DURING THE BUDGETING PROCESS BASED ON THE PERCENT INCREASE IN SALARIES. THE BUDGET IS REVIEWED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND PRESENTED TO THE BOARD FOR REVIEW/APPROVAL. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL SIGNS ALL CONTRACTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
LOSS ON WRITE-OFF OF PLEDGE RECEIVABLE -1,007,739.
